website_summaries.verdict: Popular freeze-dried cat food product that's available in multiple flavors and bag sizes for convenience.
pros: Uses minimal processing to ensure a higher-quality final product
Works well for cats of all ages
Uses only responsibly-sourced ingredients and cage-free poultry
cons: Quality control and consistency from bag to bag could be better

customer_reviews.title: Made my cat horribly sick! Overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: My healthy 4 y.o. cat vomited immediately after eating this and proceeded to vomit the entire night. He's not prone to vomiting and he doesn't have a sensitive stomach. He usually gets canned food. I tried a small amount the next day and that made him vomit again. I took him to the vet and the vet said there was nothing wrong with him and that he recommended changing the food. Not only did it make my cat sick but it's an impractical waste of money. I do not recommend this food.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Best Freeze Dried/Dehydrated Food!
customer_reviews.text: I use to work with a holistic veterinarian who recommended Stella and Chewys and other holistic forms of food. She recommended duck per the guaranteed analysis for my kitty. I brought home samples of the turkey and duck for my cats. One of my cats only liked the duck-she tried to sample the turkey, but prefers duck in general. My other cats also liked the duck! I like this particular brand and flavor because it contains everything my kitty needs and has the right amount of protein. It doesn’t lack essential vitamins, minerals, or supplements. I’ve been buying it for over 2 years and will continue to feed this to my kitties!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: My cat got very sick
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Stella & Chewys for years. This is the first time my cat has tried the rabbit formula in this particular brand. The nuggets were extremely soft and felt sort of damp, not the usual firm texture as the other flavors. I don't know if something was wrong with this particular batch, but my cat became frightfully ill from it. She was crying, vomiting forcefully, and having diarrhea at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: soozinpa

customer_reviews.title: contains vegetables
customer_reviews.text: they changed the recipe again. it now has dandelion, kelp and other unnecessary ingredients. my cats started acting weird after eating the food. cats are not vegetarians. they eat meat (rodents, birds, bugs). nothing else. there's a company called hare today that makes freeze-dried raw cat food. it includes organs, bones and no vegetables or synthetic supplements.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing food stored improperly in warehouse!
customer_reviews.text: Stella & Chewy's Freeze Dried Raw food is amazing and my cats love it!!!! BUT this food was stored in an area with fragranced products and the smell of laundry detergent has permeated the food so my cats won't eat it. I can't blame them because the smell has come right through the bag into the food. I will pay more and buy locally even though I will pay $5 more per bag.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle 123

customer_reviews.title: Hard as Rocks. Inedible!
customer_reviews.text: These morsels are hard as little rocks that I can’t even cut with a paring knife. Of course my cat can’t eat them. I will have to throw them out. They were sent by Amazon. Next time I will order from Chewy.com - their stuff is fresher.
customer_reviews.author: Loulou's Mom

customer_reviews.title: A clear winner
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this food whether batting around the pieces a la prey as a treat or served as it's supposed to be mixed with water. This is the only healthy, high quality food they lick their bowls clean when eating. The ingredients are excellent and the animals raised ethically and humanely with no hormone or antibiotic injections--the only type of pet food given to my cats. Their favorite flavors are duck and chicken.
customer_reviews.author: SaraTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Last bag
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several bags of this product for my cats however this most recent purchase was not good. It may have been contaminated as after each serving my cats vomited within 30 minutes. I tried 3 times over 3 days and one of my cats showed so much distress I will not be buying this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Starsha

customer_reviews.title: Basically gold nuggets...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has basically rescued my poor 3y/o sphynx with antibiotic induced IBD diarrhea that plagued him for over 6 months. I have over 1000 dollars in tests and worthless supplements and expensive worthless prescription food to try to solve this problem. Finally I gave in to my sphynx mom friends peer pressures and made the transition to dehydrated raw. It took less than a week to have completely solid perfect poops. I’m ecstatic. The only thing that would make it better was if it wasn’t so expensive and they made it in the bigger bag like the other proteins.
customer_reviews.author: Nikita Burke

customer_reviews.title: What happened to the formula?
customer_reviews.text: I order an 18 oz (large bag) of this every month, and have been getting it on auto delivery. I have been using this food for several years and my cat loves it. Last month's bag was a different story...the cat hated it. It smelled different...like maple syrup. I had to throw the bag away, and at $38 a bag, I was not a happy consumer. Being that I forgot the cancel, when my next bag arrived, I almost mailed it back. Decided to open it, and luckily it did not have the maple scent, and once again, the cat liked it. If I get another bag that smells like maple, I will be done with this product for good.
customer_reviews.author: tmr

customer_reviews.title: 0/5 Cats like this, Garbage product.
customer_reviews.text: Out of 5 cats none of them even looked twice at it. Tried it dry, mixed with water, mixed with food, etc. None of them wanted anything to do with it. This is the only cat food that none of my animals have been interested in. I gave the leftovers to a co-worker with 3 cats and she said the same thing. None of her kitties wanted anything to do with it. Wish I could give it zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: All our cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: We've been feeding Stella & Chewy's freeze dried food to our cats for years and they love it - all varieties, however, Chick Chick Chicken is their favorite. Before serving, I put a cup full in a mixing bowl, add half a bowl of water and Only Natural Pet Bone Broth and then - and this is my little secret: put it in the microwave for 15 seconds. When I get it out the nuggets sucked up all the water and are now really juicy. I don't have to mush it all up with a fork - I just leave the nuggets and our cats devour them!
customer_reviews.author: CatCrazy Channel

customer_reviews.title: My cats got tapeworm from this product.
customer_reviews.text: I thought putting my cats on raw food was going to be great, After two weeks of introducing this food into their diet, they both ended up with tapeworm. It has cost me over $500.00 in Vet bills and my poor cats have been miserable throwing up and diarrhea. I am sadly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging by amazon
customer_reviews.text: Good cat food just not a good idea to buy from amazon since they have no clue how to package anything. Usually I get this from the pet store but they were out. Food arrived in a giant box with some other heavy items I purchased so the food was smashed to bites. Some people mentioned they pulverize this food for their cats. You want your cats to chew on the morsels that’s what it’s intended for go clean their teeth like they would eating flesh and bones in the wild. I didn’t realize I paid for cat food in sand form.
customer_reviews.author: Shame on paid reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great food -- but one shipment possibly outdated
customer_reviews.text: I have this cat food on a standing repeat order and received a shipment yesterday. Every bag should have an expiration date stamped on the package. (It's a dehydrated, raw food.) One of the bags I received yesterday had no exp. date stamped anywhere. It's possible that it's an out of date bag and someone erased the stamped date. Also possible that it's in date and somehow escaped the date stamping process. Rather than send it back, I'll use it first and hope for the best -- but please, check all bags for an in-date stamp before shipping. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: JudithL

customer_reviews.title: What's up with this?
customer_reviews.text: Four adult cats. One cat at first sniff of this product simply tried to bury it on the floor. Cat #2 gave a gag reaction as if she was going to vomit and walked away from product. The other two just look at me as if say, Is this it, really? Oh well, my neighbor's dog will eat anything. 6/6/20. Gave the entire bag of this product to my neighbor thinking it was gone for good. This however, was wrong headed thinking. The bag was returned to me with a statement of "I thought my dog would eat anything". Her cat was smart enough to reject this product as well. Something is wrong with this product, including the price.
customer_reviews.author: mousehound369

customer_reviews.title: My British Shorthair LOVES this
customer_reviews.text: I was advised to switch our cat to eating raw food instead of Royal Canin, but I did not want to have to go through all that work (and money) of buying raw chicken from the store, blending it up, and adding vitamins. I came across Stella & Chewy through research and my can is now obsessed with this food. We've fed her different flavors and she loves them all. We noticed a significant difference in the texture of her fur (a lot softer and less shedding). However, you definitely need to portion control this food as my cat has a huge appetite and our vet told us she gain a lot of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Micki

customer_reviews.title: 50% cat approval rating
customer_reviews.text: 2 cats, 1 tail up. Our boys are 14 and 16 and quite picky about their food. We avoid kibble (cats are, after all, obligate carnivores) so being out for long stretches can be problematic. The younger snacks on S&C and the older insists on starving. So be it. I worry about bowl stability (because it is a raw dried product,)and would never push it being out for more than 8 or so hours. So far, so good. Costly to throw away leftovers <sigh>
customer_reviews.author: JoMarch

customer_reviews.title: Cat vomiting after this!
customer_reviews.text: My cat started vomiting and got lethargic every time after eating this. Tried it for 4 days and have found out this is the culprit. Back to canned and dehydrated food now with no vomits. I really wanted this to work, but indoor cats are unfortunately not wild cats and have different digestive systems that might not be suitable for raw feeding. Plus, 3 vets I have talked to agree that I should stop feeding this food. Leaving this review so people who have not fed their cats raw from the beginning can proceed with caution because a vomiting sick cat is no fun.
customer_reviews.author: Curious Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this food!!
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 cats ranging in age from 2 to 20 years. The oldest cat sometimes has days he doesn't want to eat as much, but he eats every morsel of this food, and he will finish up his canned if this is mixed in. My youngest cat I'm pretty sure would take me out for this food. I mix it with her current food. I crumble the nuggets and mix them with a bit of water and let sit. I also make bigger batches and store in the fridge (a day's worth at a time). While I can't afford feeding it to all of them exclusively right now, I would if I could; the quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Animals love this!
customer_reviews.text: My animals LOVE Stella-n-Chewy products! I have been feeding them these products for about a month now and they are all so very excited to eat - all you do is break up the patty or nugget and re-hydrate with warm water and then get the hell out of the way - animals just love it. It is a little pricey - but what's the difference between buying something they love and buying food they won't eat and tossing it out??
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Alexander Skidmore

customer_reviews.title: Chicken is only one they will touch
customer_reviews.text: I have recently had to have two of my senior cats teeth pulled (so check them often)... but they need more variety with soft foods. I like these because (1) they will eat it! (2) You can make what you want for that meal only without all the loss like canned foods (3) only chicken flavor works. I bought the duck and salmon ones... but mine will not touch those flavors. All 3 of my cats will eat they chicken ... totally up! I find it easier to shred it up... before you add water to it.
customer_reviews.author: Awen

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this product
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this product!!! I use it as a topper on their wet food. There is a move in the pet community to incorporate raw food in pets diet for healtier outcomes. With cats of different tastes, they both agree on this product. My cats don't like it rehydrated however, therefore I give as a treat and topper. As a topper they get moisture from the wet food and as a treat , the volume is limited so I don't worry so much about the dryness. The product arrived in a sealed mailing envelope.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Okay for my Cat's IBD (rabbit-specific diet)
customer_reviews.text: My cat has IBD and can only eat rabbit or hydrolyzed protein, so they work with her diet. I do use them as treats sometimes, but mostly I moisten them and mix them with her prescription food and a multivitamin for dinner. It helps add flavor; it's definitely strong-smelling so it must taste strong. It helps to stretch out the food as well, COVID has made it difficult to order her regular food, so I need all I can get.
customer_reviews.author: Tess Edgar

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this food!
customer_reviews.text: Great cat food food! A healthy food that i dont have to make! It smells really horrible but my kitty likes it. And he is a picky eater. I crush it up w my fingers and add water then crush it more and mix it. It takes a minute or so( you can use a chopper.) That's probably the only the thing my cat doesnt like about this food that he has to wait while its being made. I tried this food on a friends cat and her cat who loves food did not like this food so it depends on the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Beth and Bri

customer_reviews.title: High quality food
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. My cat is 1 1/2 and has always had really really really stinky pooh, after 2 days eating this food no more stink at all. I have a large breed cat. Maine Coon so it does get costly to keep up feeding her this brand but so worth it. I will continue to buy this food for as long as I can afford it. I wish they had some coupons or something to help ease the cost though.
customer_reviews.author: kam

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: I, actually. bought this by mistake, but after giving to my cats, I will try to buy more. (It's expensive for my budget.) I have four adult cats and, also, feed a feral cat and her (almost 4-month old) kittens. Of the four brands (and several flavors of those brands) that I've been feeding my cats over the past several months, this is the only food the kittens fight over. When I give the cats two brands at one meal, they always eat this one first, and follow me around to get me (before settling for the "other" food. I like that it is "98% chicken & fish organs & bones". I especially like the cats' enthusiasm for it.
customer_reviews.author: BuddysPal

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT, GREAT PACKAGING
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product hoping that my cats would eat it. They love it! At first, I gave them a little and just crumbled it over their kibble. After reading the directions more thoroughly, I now take a few of the "chunks" and break them in half, soak in a little water for about a minute. Then I drain off the excess water and they love this food. I am in the process of transitioning them over to more of this product. And to top it all off, the packaging is GREAT! For once, a "re-sealable" package that actually re-seals! YES!!!
customer_reviews.author: Becky of PA

customer_reviews.title: Terrific emergency supply that he LIKES
customer_reviews.text: We've made our own raw cat food for the last 10 years and don't plan to change. BUT, living in Alaska we know that all it takes is one disaster for the power to go out and ruin our stock of frozen-raw food. If I have to scoop the cat up and run for higher ground (like we did for the tsunami warning 11/30/2018) I love now having a full bag in the pantry to grab and go. Since he likes it, we also use as treats and if we run out of the homemade food, this lets us keep a fresh bag on-hand at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon in Alaska

customer_reviews.title: This is an Amazing Cat Food!
customer_reviews.text: O.k. this stuff is like kitty crack. I use it as a sprinkle over my cat's wet food. If I sprinkled it on cardboard, he'd probably eat that. If you have a finicky eater, get the smaller bag and try it. Take one piece and sprinkle half or all of it on your cat's regular food. I'd bet that your cat will eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy B

customer_reviews.title: Most cats go crazy over Stella & Chewy freeze dried morsels !
customer_reviews.text: Our cats LOVE the freeze dried turkey dinner morsels - we use them solely as treats right out of the bag - they can be a bit too rich for some cats, so you need to disperse these sparingly.....We have tried the chicken and the fish versions as well, but our cats prefer the turkey over all others -
customer_reviews.author: Bradis

customer_reviews.title: Morsels Crushed Into Powder
customer_reviews.text: The bag of Salmon/Chicken arrived with half the morsels crushed into a powder. Very disappointing - I will not be purchasing cat food on Amazon again, and will go back to my local pet store instead. Also, my cat doesn’t really like the flavor of this one, and doesn’t finish his bowl of food when I give him the salmon/chicken. The chicken flavor by itself he loves and gobbles all of it up.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine O.

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this product.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I contacted Amazon for a refund for the Stella & Chewy's Chic Chic Chicken Dinner Morsels. I'm a first time buyer of this product. My kitten liked it enough that I would have considered buying it again. I want to advise consumers that I found multiple dead flies in the packaging. This is a big turn off. I wouldn't feed this to any animal. I contacted Stella & Chewy's, but they are not taking calls at this time due to Covid. Their associates are working from home, and I have not received a return call as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Josie Lipscomb

customer_reviews.title: Quality food that cat craves
customer_reviews.text: My cat meows for this stuff like she’s never eaten before. She loves it. I usually break each piece into two pieces as the chunks are too large for her, whole. I tried mixing it with water to make “wet” food but she likes it dry. So I feed it to her as a snack or when her Apaws wet food is not enough. The main reason I bought this was because of the quality and that there were no chemicals or grain or fake food. We personally are Keto/Paleo/Organic so we try to feed our cat with healthy and natural food as well. It’s on the expensive side but all quality food is for humans as well.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some treats that wouldn't be too hard for my beloved kitty to chew after he was on the mend from some dental treatments. I crushed these up a bit with my hands and he loves them - they come out kind of fluffy and powdery and he found them easy to eat. He gets very excited for them! And I'm happy knowing he is getting healthy food and not the equivalent of junk food.
customer_reviews.author: City Gal

customer_reviews.title: I use it as dry food for my Persian tabby
customer_reviews.text: My cat is very weird and only licks her food. So any wet food is useless as she will lick the fatty gravy and leave the meaty parts. So, I tried this freeze-dried food. I added water as the directions indicate. But my weirdo cat just smelled and walked away. (throwing attitude). Then I tried to give it like dry food and left the chunks in the plate. Voila!!! Made her eat the meat !!! She thinks this is a treat (So she is dumb too). Finally, I got a victory. Her fur has improved greatly. And her poop doesn't smell. She has more stamina than before. P.S: She drinks enough water.
customer_reviews.author: ket

customer_reviews.title: Great nutrients for aging fur babies with poor appetites
customer_reviews.text: My ferrets absolutely love this food. The second they are out they are standing by the food dish waiting for their Duck Duck Goose. I have had such a hard time introducing any new foods to their diet, but they took to this one right away. One of my fur babies is developing some health problems in her old age, and this food stimulates her appetite and helps give her the nutrients she needs. The price is expensive, but it lasts for quite a while with two ferrets and you can't beat the quality. I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Wished my cats would like this, but....
customer_reviews.text: All of us cat folks know cats can be fussier than kids. You do the research to find the best food. You present it, and you get that look that says "you gotta be kidding." I know there are cats out there that will think this food is great, but for the price, it was an expensive experiment.
customer_reviews.author: R. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Made kitty sick
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this product did not work for me. I had tried a smaller bag, same brand/company of their chicken flavor. Kitty seemed to like it and I thought her poops weren't smelling as bad. I decided to try switching her to this food then and getting her another flavor (turkey). Unfortunately, she threw up multiple times each time she ate the food. I'm not sure if it's the bag we received or the flavor. She has traditionally enjoyed and stomached turkey with no problem in other products. Not saying it's a bad product and won't work for you, but it just didn't for us. I'm a little leery about trying the chicken again :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat went crazy when I open it, although not the kind of raw food I expected
customer_reviews.text: He absolutely went crazy every time I open the bag. I used it as a treat or an add-on to his meal. I only bought it once because it's pricy. The product description says freeze-dried raw. I was a little disappointed because the description is misleading. They added various ingredients to the "raw morsels." They definitely processed the "raw" meat before freeze-dry. I was hoping the "raw morsels" were just freeze-dried raw meat.
customer_reviews.author: Boyang Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and healthy
customer_reviews.text: It's so difficult to find a healthy food for your cat, especially raw food. Since its morsels, you choose how you make the food. One cat loves chunky, one loves pate. So I make it how they like and theyll eat more! It's so much easier than making your own raw food (did in the past and wow... gross and time consuming) Of course you have to do the slow transition, one kitty wouldn't touch it for a while. We did 90% to 10% and slowly added more morsels Now she gobbles it up. It's also the same price as our other food and soooooooo much healthier. We have subscribed to this cat food!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Cat doesn't like it
customer_reviews.text: We tried the turkey and the chicken, even bought a second bag of chicken... results are in: ~ She wasn't crazy about the turkey from the start, but did get through part of the bag. Now she just walks away every time, even if I just give it to her once a week. ~ Chicken Review: Same story although it took longer for her to start walking away. So we're done with this and back to just Primal.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Total deal for health!
customer_reviews.text: It's expensive to feed your pets well. But...this is the way. 95% real animal product! Can't go wrong there. Animal kids need the whole animal.....bone....livers....heart....meat...you get it. It's in here!
customer_reviews.author: Price

customer_reviews.title: These STINK....badly.  They are raw.  I threw them away.
customer_reviews.text: CON: These stink as if they are rotten. They are very large for our cat. about 5 times the size of the large Greenies. So, we gave him 1 or 2 in his other food. They really stink. They are RAW. I don't know if that is bad. PRO: ??? Did I mention that they really smell bad? They stink like old dead meat. I finally threw 90% of them away.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Whaley

customer_reviews.title: Nice treats for kitties
customer_reviews.text: This food overall is good except for a little bit expensive. Lots of salmon smells when I open the bag. All of my cats go crazy for it but they have difficulty biting it dry so I break it into smaller pieces and use as food topper. Tried to soak in water but they don't like it that way. I will only buy it as a treat/topper due to the price because three cats can eat up to 9 bags of this in a month if it's their normal diet..........
customer_reviews.author: Deans

customer_reviews.title: truly saved my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat was diagnosed with ibs and antibiotic responsive diarrhea. After months of diarrhea, weight loss, antibiotics and prednosolone, feeding Duck Duck Goose brought normal stools in 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Unappealing changes to color, scent, texture, or product was old or damaged
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my cat. It's a staple of her diet. As soon as I opened this bag, everything was different than usual: (1) The color of the food was much darker; (2) There was a strong odor that the food doesn't normally have; (3) Many of the pieces were struck together, and dried out. My cat wouldn't go near this food she normally enjoys. I didn't have time to return it, and threw it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Stumblena

customer_reviews.title: Easy to feed product.  No grain.
customer_reviews.text: The freeze dried”logs”. Are rectangular and very easy to crumble into smaller pieces. It has a very low odor and my kitty adores this nutrient dense food. I do not wet it, I provide a pet water fountain for my cat to drink from in the same area she is fed because I was concerned that it might spoil if she nibbles on it over the course of the day. I feed a variety of foods and this product probably won’t cause dental problems like kibble does. A whole log is too much for one feeding for my cat. I store it in the fridge and it has resealable zip top.
customer_reviews.author: Insync

customer_reviews.title: Finally Found Another Food For My Allergy Kitty
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with allergies and the biggest problem that I tend to have with raw foods is the amount of extra ingredients that are usually added. I like to keep the ingredients to a minimum to avoid any risks of reactions. This food fits the bill for him! And he actually likes the flavor! Will even want them as a dry treat here and there. So glad that Stella and Chewy is making this. Filling a great need in the pet allergy food market. There is only one other brand that I am comfortable feeding him so this is a great addition!
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda F. DoveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great ingredients
customer_reviews.text: Cat really likes this, and her fur has been super soft since using so it must be good! I have been using it along with Dr. Elseys (alternating days). Her poop has smelled a bit better. Ingredients seem high quality, so I will continue to buy! I like that you can rehydrate - I have been able to add quite a bit of water when rehydrating, so I know she’s getting a good amount of liquid with her food.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Cat, every witch needs at least one.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a small bag and gradually combined rehydrated nuggets into my cats kibble, over a few weeks. My cat didn’t seem to like the nuggets but they’d be gone by the next feed time so in anticipation of a full on completing the weening I puchased a larger bag but before needing to open the newer bag I noticed she had a very itchy face and scabs along her mouth and what looked like acne. Turned out she is allergic to the new food.
customer_reviews.author: Marguerite Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Great food but painful price
customer_reviews.text: My underweight female has a lot of food allergies, but is a very picky eater who refuses to eat homemade cat food. She loves this stuff and it's helped her start to be more open to other foods. I think she was scared to eat because her allergies made her puke up everything with grain in it. It's too expensive to be the main food, though. It cost us roughly $80 a month to feed 1 6lb female. We gradually weaned her off it for a cheaper alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Schnapp

customer_reviews.title: Add LOTS of water
customer_reviews.text: Suggest at least 1/4 cup water per 1/2 cup serving of food. This stuff does not soften readily which means you need to add lots of water which cats do need. Absorption of food to water takes about 15 minutes+. Kitty loves the stuff! I'm thinking about putting the freeze-dried food in my Vitamix and chopping it up into smaller pieces so as to make it absorb water more quickly and get impatient kitty off my case. :)
customer_reviews.author: Rubber Duck

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best way to give our cats raw food. It's dehydrated, so I boil water and pour it over a bowl full of this food. Then I wait a little while and mash it up with a fork. Our cats LOVE it! This is their special treat. I give it to them a couple of times a week to make it special. It's pretty expensive, so feeding it to them every day wouldn't be affordable. But that also makes it more desirable to our cats because it's not an "every day" food! =^..^=
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Ebert

customer_reviews.title: had high hopes
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping this very expensive product might be good in bug-out bag for emergencies. Raw is supposed to be healthy to feed cats. Kitten not the least bit interested-wet or dry, it was a NO. Glad I didnt get a bigger container.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Cat NC

customer_reviews.title: unfortunately too big for my cat
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately the food is a bit too big for my cat.. He likes small bites even though he is kinda large. even though i tried pulling them apart to make them smaller he just had no interest in them at all. the good thing is that my old dog that has very few teeth left really liked them so he may end up with new treats.
customer_reviews.author: Edzew Kurai

customer_reviews.title: Best cat food ever
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is wasted. No messy, stinky cans. No worry that the kibble has too much filler. Cats, unlike dogs, are carnivores. This product is all meat, no filler. It smells pleasant. Can be crumbled and mixed with water or broth, but my cat prefers the whole pieces. Her vet recommended, for her age, to feed her fowl (like chicken). He cautioned that fish was too high protein for her. DuckDuckGoose is perfect. I highly recommend. Yes, it is pricey but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Anne Hagerstrom

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch?
customer_reviews.text: I love Stella and Chewy's products and have used them many times for both my cats and dogs. This is my first time ordering it from Amazon, and the bag of Chicken freeze dried cat morsels was extremely dry and crumbly, not soft like the morsels normally are. It does not rehydrate well at all. The batch is not expired, but I'm extremely dissatisfied with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D.

customer_reviews.title: Kittys hate it.
customer_reviews.text: Can't say much it stinks and my younger kitty tries to bury it like she would when she goes potty. Wouldn't order again. Just had to throw it away. Both cats turned their noses up and refused to eat this.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Price

customer_reviews.title: No crumbs just solid product
customer_reviews.text: I was really worried when I saw a bunch of reviews about the pieces coming mostly crushed up. But I decided if that does happen I can mix it in with her food and she’ll still get the health benefits from it. And I’m glad I did! There was absolutely no pieces that were crushed up and it came with my wysong food in the box too! Every single piece in there was solid and there was no crumbs at the bottom of the bag. Plus my ferret, who is pretty picky, caught onto them right away and now she loves them! Yummy healthy treat for her. I will be buying again over and over and over!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it but check bag size / price
customer_reviews.text: First: Completely my fault: I read the product details very quickly, and just assumed that for $10, I was getting a 3.5 POUND bag of cat food. The small bag is 3.5 OUNCES.. basically a sample size. On the plus side: my very finicky cat LOVES it. Back to the negative; I’m not paying that price for an actual real-sized bag of cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D

customer_reviews.title: MY CATS REJECTED IT!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions, served the cats and they all REJECTED this product! Then I tried crushing it up in some water, to make a paste and they still rejected it! Wasted my money... It's back to tuna for them.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Nice flavor but many pieces were crushed
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality treats. You get a good amount for the price. These can also be given to dogs. Ours love them! The consistency isn't the same as the last freeze-dried treats I bought: these aren't flakey, more like "puffy". My only disappointment was that there was a lot of product "powder" in the bag from the pieces being crushed, so one less star.
customer_reviews.author: K. LORI

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Love It but Too Expensive
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to start feeding my cat good stuff, raw meat and I saw this and ordered it. I expected a full bag for $39.99 but when I opened it, the bag wasn't full. This seemed very expensive for what they give you. And it smelled bad. I was at first afraid to feed it to my cats, but they went crazy over the smell after I opened the bag. My husband was outraged when he found how much this product is. Won't be reordering it due to cost.
customer_reviews.author: Sunset Lover

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review After Contacting Stella & Chewy's
customer_reviews.text: Update: I contacted Stella & Chewy's. There was a misprint of ingredients on a batch of labels. The Cat Food Formula has not been changed. The misprint listed Dog Food ingredients instead of the Cat Food ingredients. I fed this to my cats and one of them violently vomited the food. There is apparently a change in the formula that includes vegetables and fruits.
customer_reviews.author: Bliss Grey

customer_reviews.title: They liked the duck
customer_reviews.text: All 3 of my cats liked this, the duck flavor. That’s never happened before! The ingredients looked good. I gave them the pellets with hot water on them. I see there are some reviews from the past where they’ve changed the ingredients, so I’m including a picture of what I received February 2020. I wish these were cheaper, I would buy it again at the deal of the day price
customer_reviews.author: julia

customer_reviews.title: Not an enthusiatic response.
customer_reviews.text: I thought my indoor/outdoor hunter cat would enjoy this food. However, he was not enamored and I have to hand feed him bits. If I put it in a dish he ignores it which makes me question how "raw" it is. He has devoured complete rabbits and squirrels so I know he knows what real raw food tastes like.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Another meaning of worth purchesed
customer_reviews.text: Both of my kitties don't like it. they will leave them in the bowl unless they super hungry. The other brand work much better. But! I always concern my kitties eat too much, while one of them gain weight too fast. So another meaning, it make my kitties only eat when they really need. That's why I give a 4 stars. Will considering try other favor next time.
customer_reviews.author: nikomini

customer_reviews.title: Dust in a bag
customer_reviews.text: My cats love Stella & Chewys, and lately the salmon and cod have been their favorite. Seller didn't ship in a box, but rather an envelope. Item arrived flat as a pancake. The morsels came crushed like dust. Cats will not eat it.
customer_reviews.author: soozinpa

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My cat goes crazy for this! She loves it and gets excited every time it’s sitting in the water to rehydrate. She’s a kitten and her coat is beautiful she has great energy levels and it’s all thanks to this amazing food!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Defective bag of food. No $ back
customer_reviews.text: Usually this is a good product. But I got a bag that my cats won’t eat, I opened another bag right away and they ate that one. $37 wasted because it’s past the return date since I was getting too many with my subscribe and save and they just ate it now. If I’d gotten it from a store I’d get my $ back which I will do from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Linley

customer_reviews.title: Not for my cats
customer_reviews.text: I think The quality is good, my cats would not touch it though. They usually eat anything. Vet wants them on a novel protein diet as two have developed allergies. Finding a quality food they will eat has been a challenge. I tried it reconstituted as directed and they were not having it.
customer_reviews.author: tooniefan

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves Stella & Chewy's!
customer_reviews.text: Stella & Chewy's Freeze Dried food is great! My cat is EXTREMELY finicky and she has feline stomatitis, so this food is a blessing for her. Its the one thing I know she will always eat. Its easy to prepare...just add water! I would recommend this food for any cat, especially those with digestive or dental problems.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonlady

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this is probably very good food, but my cat doesn't like it. She tries to cover it up with invisible sand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Freeze drying raw cat food is a great idea. One of my cats loves it. The other won't touch it. It's just the nature of the beast and not a reflection of the product. So I get it for the one that will eat it. I started out with the smallest package in case no one wanted it. Now I get the largest package for the one who loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Raw Food Cat Treats!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old cat Ollie has been on Primal frozen raw food since he was 3 months old. I wanted a raw food snack for him and these morsels make the perfect treat. They're healthy and Ollie loves them. He gets about 4 "cookies" a day. He's lean, muscular and very happy! >^..^<
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Meh..
customer_reviews.text: My boy cat has asthma so I wanted to try freeze dried food (no grain). He and my other cat pretty much turned their noses up at it. I like that it seems to have pure ingredients. I learned after the first day that you need to rehydrate the food with water, though my kitties still didn't care for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kimi Rose

customer_reviews.title: My cats won't leave me alone
customer_reviews.text: My cats are always asking me for this now. One of them used to have energy problems, and now he's jumping all over the place happy.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Polo

customer_reviews.title: My cat turned it's nose up at them.
customer_reviews.text: My cat - who eats anything. Dogfood (before the dog even has a bite), Peaches, Apples etc, turned her nose up at these. What's the deal with their huge price increase? Went from 29 dollars to 40 dollars overnight. That's a lot for dried out crumbly pieces of I-don't-know-what.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this as a treat to supplement their fully raw frozen meat diet.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love the Chick Chick Chicken product and I like to use it as a treat to supplement the fully raw meat diet (which I purchase frozen from another company). The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is I prefer full meat products for my cats so they are eating as close to what they might eat in the wild (i.e. cats wouldn't eat fenugreek and pumpkin seeds in the wild). But this is one of my preferred freeze-dried brands due to the limited added ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: EMPOWERED GIRL

customer_reviews.title: Senior Kitty Loves Stella & Chewy
customer_reviews.text: My senior cat loves Stella & Chewy!!! She had digestive issues even with prescription cat food. Just 3 months ago our vet had to extract 3 of her teeth due to decay. My cat loves this raw food & has no digestive issues. Miss Senior Kitty is more active and seems happier! Raw diet works for my kitty!
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great product, my bangle kitty loves them. All 5 of my cats love them so much h we have to store them in a hard plastic container. They will climb shelving and chew through the packaging to get to them. It has made my cats coats so shiny and soft and my 9 year old cat is acting like a kitten. It's like these things gave her, her energy and youth back.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: My cats would not eat these. When I put them with their regular food as a supplement, they ate around them. gave them to someone who had a new little kitty. Does not mean they are not a good thing for cats but mine looked at me like you want to explain these cubes
customer_reviews.author: Shirley M.

customer_reviews.title: My picky cat loves this.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older, very fussy cat. As soon as I think I have found something that he likes--and bought it in bulk--he changes his mind. So far, he has not rejected this and I have bought it several times already. So far, so good. I like that I can get extra water into him by mixing the food with additional water. And I like not having messy smelly cans of food hanging around. this is so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Whitman

customer_reviews.title: Has Helped my Mature Cat
customer_reviews.text: My beloved cat is 18 years old and this food has seriously improved her life (and mine!). I've fed my cat Blue Buffalo for years thinking I was giving her the best kibble I could find at the store, but after hearing reports that brand was being linked to heart disease in pets, I did my research and came across Stella and Chewy's rabbit. Since starting her on this food she barfs less and her litter box doesn't stink up the whole house between cleanings. She seems happier and more energetic and I couldn't be more thankful!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Le Bel

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it so I love it
customer_reviews.text: I keep trying to get my cat to eat healthier food but he's addicted to "junk food" aka Friskies. However, if I crush up a couple of these freeze dried chicken bits and mix them into literally any other cat food, my cat will dive right in. It's like the hot sauce of the cat world. Because I don't use these as his main source of food, each bag lasts me about a month and a half so it's a great value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: ToWhenTFor

customer_reviews.title: or one cat who doesn't chew food much due to bad teeth: -( will try to scarf it whole ...
customer_reviews.text: My cats are crazy for these freeze-dired morsels. I mostly feed them homemade raw food, so these are for treats and snacks - can't feed whole though, or one cat who doesn't chew food much due to bad teeth :-( will try to scarf it whole and become uncomfortable when the morsel lodges in his throat. I crush them between my fingers a bit. Add a little warm water and presto! in less than a minute, great food for your kitty!
customer_reviews.author: Lori722

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it 😍
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this! She likes the fish flavors more than the chicken. The food rehydrates quickly or you can feed it to them dry as an additive with other food if they drink a lot of water. I used it as a supplement to help improve her skin and hair quality. Fair warning- this smells as terrible as you would expect dried fish to.
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: STINKY!!
customer_reviews.text: The cats Love them and the ingredients are good, but if they leave just one of these things in the bowl, the whole house begins to stink like Fish! I wish they had the other flavors for cats. And leave out plenty of Water! They will need it with these.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Happy Kitteh... Happy Life
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food. You do really need to pay attention to making sure it is properly rehydrated/your kitty has access to water. Otherwise you might have a bit of a stopped up kitty. I will say her coat is super shiny and soft, and she loves this food!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca C. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Cats do not approve of duck
customer_reviews.text: My cats have been eating the chicken and chicken/salmon varieties. I decided to try the duck, but none of the 3 will eat it. The nuggets are a lot harder than the other 2 varieties and some are darker colored inside. They are hard enough to make it difficult to crumble and had to use a mortar.
customer_reviews.author: Gladys P.

customer_reviews.title: My kitty loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We had almost given up on feeding our cat anything but one particular hard brand. He is so particular, after a few cans of anything he would walk away after turning up his nose. Now he waits patiently for the food to rehydrate and then licks it up clean! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Mickie

customer_reviews.title: One of the better raw foods
customer_reviews.text: They didn’t love it but also didn’t hate it. Cats! So picky. If you have multiple catabits hard to get a premade bag of raw food at a decent price so I’ve been experimenting w different brands and techniques. Probably my cats are gonna try to hitch hike to the next state cos their sick of it - but I do it bcos I love them!
customer_reviews.author: No

customer_reviews.title: Good Size and last awhile
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these and we just discovered the duck flavor which is even better. I use as a food topper and treat. I just break up one or two and sprinkle on top of her wet food. This is a good size bag for one cat or even two and last quite awhile. Arrived fast in a padded envelope.
customer_reviews.author: Shivani McK

customer_reviews.title: Price Increase
customer_reviews.text: Price went up substantially from the last time I bought this here. 2 for $14.99 last time. 1 for $19.99 this time.
customer_reviews.author: pmp

customer_reviews.title: Great add in to dry food! perfect replacement for wet food days
customer_reviews.text: Purrefect *is what my cat says*. It’s nice and soft but not mushy. Perfect add in on top or mixed into the dry food. You can crush it up into bits as well to add in or give it to your cat as a treat. My cat loves it! Perfect replacement for wet food days
customer_reviews.author: emerald maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Fish Skin(?) and bones inside!
customer_reviews.text: I brought my cat turkey dinner (It was okay) before and brought him the salmon and cod this time. It is awful. I crushed the cubes, 3 out of 12 has these little sharp pieces, and fish skin(?) that couldn't break apart. You can see how hard I tried to break them in the video. I wonder how my cat survive if he swallowed these pieces with his little tiny throat and probably go through his intestines with pain. I would never buy this product again. NEVER.
customer_reviews.author: SYL

customer_reviews.title: Wow ! They smelled this from outside box
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats ages 14 and 15 tore into the box to get to the Stella and Chewy food. they played with it dry and licked it ,then I put the warm water on it and mixed it in w/ one of the blue Buffalo wet food . they usually like to share a plate but this time they were pushing to get the food. That's a 5 + review by cats
customer_reviews.author: T.Held

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, made in the USA. Convenient as it can be fed dry or wet. Lightweight, too, so it packs well to take your pet’s familiar food with you on a trip. This flavor, Salmon & Chicken, is the 2nd place choice for my 4 cats. So far (this week, ha!), Duck, Duck, Goose flavor is the winner in the 1st place spot. Rabbit flavor comes in 3rd place, with Salmon and Cod coming in last.
customer_reviews.author: ebaygirl

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  I'm impressed with this!
customer_reviews.text: My always hungry cat now no longer begs for food every time I move. She is more satisfied and content than I've ever seen her since I adopted her at the age of 8 five years ago. I have not been able to get her to lose weight but think that this just might do it!
customer_reviews.author: Christine M. Kaufmann

product_meta.title: Stella & Chewy's Freeze-Dried Raw Dinner Morsels for Cats
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Duck| Size:18 OunceEvery pet parent wants wholesome, natural nutrition for their pet. Stella & Chewy's raw diets focus on pure ingredients and raw protein so you can feed them as nature intended. At Stella & Chewy's we believe that pure raw nutrition fed in its natural state is the best way to help your pet thrive. Our limited ingredient recipes are simple and pure. Each batch of Dinner Morsels for cats starts with 98% meat, organs and bone and is often a single source of animal protein, the perfect solution for pets with food sensitivities. Each protein is grass-fed, cage-free or wild caught to guarantee your pet is eating as nature intended. All of the produce in our recipes are 100% organic certified, grown by farmers we trust. Our all-natural recipes are crafted with care in our own USA kitchen to provide the highest levels of protein rich meat and quality nutrition for your pet, as if they were in the wild. In the Stella & Chewy's kitchen, we take time to craft each recipe in small batches from the world's finest ingredients. All of our ingredients are responsibly sourced.
feature_bullets: Only the good stuff! Cats naturally crave meat, much like they ate in the wild. That's why every batch of Duck Duck Goose Freeze-Dried Raw Dinner Morsels cat food contains 98% poultry, organs and bone, plus taurine and probiotics for dietary health and eating as nature intended. All ingredients are responsibly sourced

Made in the USA - Stella & Chewy's Freeze-Dried Raw Duck Duck Goose Dinner's all-natural recipe is crafted with care in small batches in Stella & Chewy’s own USA kitchen to provide the highest levels of protein-rich meat and quality nutrition for your cat

All-natural and minimally processed. Because the closer foods stay to their natural state, the better they are. That's why each of Stella & Chewy's Dinner Morsels recipes contains no added hormones, antibiotics, grains or fillers. Best of all, it's 100% complete and balanced for all life stages
Raw nutrition and convenience - your pet deserves to thrive on real, raw meat. Now, Stella & Chewy's makes it easier than ever to give your pet real raw nutrition with the convenience of freeze-dried

Supports better health for your pet with improved appetite and digestion, relief from allergies, vibrant skin and coat, healthy teeth and gums, greater stamina and vitality and a healthy immune system
100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE on "Ships from and sold by Amazon.com" items. Questions? Contact Stella & Chewy's at 888-477-8977
